title: Understanding $$t-test$$ assumptions
text: Before performing a $$t-test$$, it's crucial to ensure that certain assumptions about the data are met. These assumptions help validate the results of the test.

title: Normality Assumption
text: One of the key assumptions of a $$t-test$$ is that the data should be normally distributed. This means that the data should follow a bell-shaped curve when plotted.

title: Identifying the correct assumption
text: Which of the following is an assumption of a $$t-test$$?
